Glena is 35 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanbga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four children. Glena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to make a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for 10 years. She earns a monthly average of PHP 5,000 from this work. 

Glena requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell such as snack items, soft drinks, etc. Glena has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Glena hopes to expand her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as snack items, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and is the mother of four children. Lydia used her last loan to order additional stocks of liquor to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she is taking a new loan to purchase new items including shampoo, milks, soap and etc to expand her product offering. She hopes to be able to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items including shampoo, milks, soap and etc to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman who has three children. Judith is 29 years old and resides at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Judith owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase additional stock items such as shampoo, milks and etc. to sell. In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Judith wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock items such as shampoo, milks and etc. to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is from Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and single. To make a living, Alice is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community, such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and more. Alice has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Alice is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase refreshment items to sell. In 2011, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase refreshment items to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married woman, Victoria is 41 years old, having two children and residing at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

Victoria is operating a venture business, buying and selling salt in the local community to earn a living and his been 13 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,230.00 PHP doing this type of business.

Victoria is requested a loan of 7,000.00 to pay for the daily rental of her selling area. In 2007 Victoria is been a member of GDMPC. In the future, Victoria wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the daily rental of her selling area

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. Gloria is engaged in the business of selling clothing in order to make a living. The family also derives income from raising pigs and from motorcycle transportation, from which Gloria makes a good return. These businesses have allowed her to earn approximately 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month, considering all sources of revenue. Gloria has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase supplementary goods to sell (Clothes). Gloria is a GDMPC member who joined last year. In the future, Gloria hopes to be successful in her business. She has plans to improve her house as well as finishing the studies of her children.

loans.use: Purchase supplementary goods to sell (Clothes)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Labinay, Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Gloria is married with five children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional grocery goods to sell and space rent. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery goods to sell and space rent

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is a married woman and has five children.  She is 37 years old, and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  Margie owns and operates a farm.  For 20 years she has been in this business.  Planting and harvesting vegetables and bananas as well as coconut for sale earns her a living.  Each month she earns PHP 20,000 over all.  She requested a loan of 43,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  Margie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  In the future, Margie wants to make improvements to her house and she wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Zenitha

texts.en:
Zenitha is from Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Zenitha is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Zenitha owns and operates a cafe business, cooking & selling a variety of goods and foods in the local community. Zenitha has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Zenitha is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy raw materials in making viands for cooked food selling. In 2010, Zenitha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in making viands for cooked food selling.

loans.name: Wilson Sr.

texts.en:
Wilson is from Tagodalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 50 years old. His is born on April 4, 1961. Wilson is married and has two children. 

To earn a living, Wilson owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables and bananas for sale. 

Wilson has been doing this work for two years and he earns 2,500 PHP monthly. 

In 2011, Wilson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong is 40 years old and is married with five children. She has been managing a farming business for almost 25 years. She describes herself as a humble villager, but she is diligent in her business. Her spouse also works in the same type of this business and serves as a source of income for the family.

Now, Tong is requesting her second loan from a Kiva partner HKL to rent a plantation for growing and selling potatoes. She wants to develop her business to earn a higher income and save some of it to ensure a good education for her school-age children. She also wants to buy a plantation in the coming years.

loans.use: to rent a plantation for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 57 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Fe has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Fe hopes to expand her dried fish vending business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en:
Germelina is fifty-seven years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children. 

Germelina operates a motor-cab for hire business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14900 to purchase equipment for her motor cab for hire . 

Germelina has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future,  Germelina hopes to buy another motor-cab.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motor cab for hire

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 46 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with 3 children. 
Clarita has a general store. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 25000  to purchase more stocks for her general store.
She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Donguel

texts.fr: Madame Donguel  née en 1973 fait du commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle achète pour revendre des habits prêt à porter. Elle exerce cette activité en permanence mais à l’habitude  de réduire ou d’augmenter la quantité de ses achats compte tenu de la période. Et vu que la période de la chaleur approche, elle va diversifier les produits en achetant des habits adaptés à l’été. Donguel es t marié mais à part ses charges personnelles, elle n’a en pas d’autres. Actuellement  ce qu’elle aimerait le plus c’est  d’ouvrir une boutique d’habillement.
texts.en: Madame Donguel was born in 1973 and has been in business for 10 years. She buys and resells ready-to-wear clothes. She's always had this occupation, but sometimes will decrease or increase the quantity of her purchases depending on the season. Given that the hot season is coming, she will diversify her products by buying clothes appropriate for summer. Donguel is married, but besides her personal expenses, she has no other expenses. What she would love most would be to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes for resale.

loans.name: La Cueva Del Cabrito (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "la cueva  del cabrito"   y se integra de tres  señoras quien cada una se  dedica a su respectiva actividad y se ubica en  un lugar pequeño.
Maria de Jesús  quien   es casada con el señor José Ángel con quien procreo cuatro hijos que  aun están a su responsabilidad.
Maria solcito el préstamo para invertirlo  en la compra de  zapatos por catalogo  de la marca Andrea y Terra en donde  lleva trabajando   un mes ya que el préstamo  anterior lo invirtió en ropa  en la que le dio  muy poco resultados.
Inicio  con esta actividad ya que también quiere poyar a su esposo  con los ingresos  para el hogar y así   darle un mejor ingreso a su pequeña familia que es lo más importante para ella.
Lo  que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajado para  tener lo  más necesaria en  su hogar.
La personas que integran en el grupo son las señoras: América quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de  cosméticos y la señora Maria Sarai en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The group is called "La Cueva del Cabrito” (Cave Kid) and is comprised of three women, each of whom are dedicated to their respective trade, in this small work space.

Maria de Jesus is married to Jose Angel with whom she has four dependent children.

Maria requests the loan to invest in buying shoes from the “Andrea & Land” brand catalog with which she has been working for the past month, as her previous loan was for clothing, which resulted in little profits. 

She started this activity because it also wants to support her husband with the household income, and therefore provide more support to their small family, which is the most important to her.

What she hopes, is that with this little activity, she can keep working to provide more household necessities.  

The people that form the group are these ladies: America, who will invest her loan to buy cosmetics and also Maria Sarai who will  purchase merchandise to stock her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is married with 4 children. Albina is 62 years old and lives in Lumban, Tangub City.
To earn a living, Albina  has a dried fish retail business. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3000.She has requested a loan of 5000 to pay for her education for the tuition of 2nd year college daughter.Albina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.
In the future, Albina hopes that her daughter will graduate in college.

loans.use: to pay for her education for the tuition of 2nd year college daughter

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married with 2 children. Jean is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Jean is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase feeds for pigs. 
Jean has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for pigs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 57 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with 4 children. 
Wilma has a construction business and earns approximately PHP 7000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50000 to purchase materials for her timber sales business . 
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her timber sales business

loans.name: Saidou Nourou

texts.fr:
Le client s’appelle Saidou Nourou. Il loge à quelques kilomètres de la caisse et est très assidu à l’épargne. Il est né en 1972, est marié et a 4 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter des moutons et des chèvres, à les élever au fin de les revendre. Il a une expérience de 5 ans.
Saidou Nourou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et de l’éducation de ses enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 12 ans et le cadet, 2 ans.
C’est un habitué de la caisse car il est à son 4ème crédit et il continuera à solliciter l’appui de celle-ci parce qu’il a un projet qui nécessite un financement consistant. Il projette d’augmenter son volume d’achat et d’ouvrir une ferme.
texts.en: The client’s name is Saidou Nourou. He lives a few kilometers from the branch office and is very diligent with his savings. He was born in 1972, is married, and has 4 children. His business consists of buying sheep and goats and them raising them for resale. He has been doing this for 5 years. Saidou Nourou takes care of the household expenses and the education of his children - the oldest of whom is 12 and the youngest of whom is 2. He’s a regular borrower from the branch office, and this is 4th loan. He will continue to ask for support because his project requires substantial financing. He plans on increasing his purchase volume and opening a farm.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats that he will raise and resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine lives in Sinkor. She is single and has 2 children aged 9 and 6 years old. For the past  years now, she has been selling nails and other items. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more nails,cement,paint and many other items for her business. Her goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more nails,cement,paint and many other items for her business

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Natalie is 45 years old and lives in Bonifacio. She is married with 2 children. 
Natalie has a dress shop that sells different style of dress. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5000  to purchase more fashion dresses for her dress shop.
Natalie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion dresses for her dress shop

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is a 43-year-old married woman. She has six children all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Samuel and he works as a teacher. Edda operates a cereals shop and sells her goods at the market. Her primary customers are her neighbours. Her other source of income is from her farm produce. 

Edda describes her greatest business challenge as being the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Edda will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice. Edda aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: One Word Group-Ii

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Word Group II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is aged 33; she was born in Koidu city where she is currently living together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a miner and her children are attending primary and secondary school respectively. For three years now, Fatmata has been selling slippers. With this loan, she will buy slippers at wholesale price to add to her business.

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy slippers at wholesale price to add to her business

loans.name: If God Gree Group

texts.en:
Finda is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Finda was born in Koidu city about 43 years ago. She is single with four children – one in primary school and one in college. Finda sells palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc.

With the help of this loan, Finda and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Finda will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a widow who has five children. She operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are her neighbours. Hope's other source of income involves selling second-hand clothes. She describes her greatest business challenge as being dry seasons which lead to low purchasing power: her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hope will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. Hope aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Girasol Copal (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Adelfa vive en una comunidad pequeña  llamada el copal, ella es casada con el señor Gregorio con quien  procreo cinco hijos quienes a un están a su  responsabilidad.

     Ella solicito  el  préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ganados en donde lleva trabajando    tres años   y un mes en donde comenta que le ha dado  un buen resultado  para su familia.
 
     Adelfa inicio  esta actividad para apoyar  a su  esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y así darle lo más necesario a su pequeña familia, así don Gregorio es el que se encarga de comprar y vender los ganados mientras que la señora Adelfa se dedica a la alimnetación de los animales y al hogar, aunque en ocasiones también sale a vender con su esposo.
 
     Lo  que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda  seguir trabajando mientras  la sigan apoyando.
 
    Quienes integran en el grupo son: Mayola quien invertiría en la compra y venta de pollos, Juana en bordado de prendas artesanales, Guadalupe en abarrotes, Amelia en  abarrotes, Laura bordado de  prendas artesanales y Mercedes en  compra y venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
Adelfa lives in a small community called Copal.  She is married to Gregorio and they have five children who are still in their care.

She is requesting a loan for her cattle business which she has been in for a little over three years.  She says the results have been good for her family.

Adelfa started the business to be able to help her husband cover household expenses and give their small family everything they need.  Gregorio buys and sells the cattle and Adelfa takes care of feeding the animals and running the household.  Sometimes she goes out to sell with her husband.

She wants to continue with her small business as long as she continues receiving support.

The members of the group are: Mayola who will invest in buying and selling chickens, Juana in hand embroidered clothing, Guadalupe in groceries, Amelia in groceries, Laura in hand embroidered clothing and Mercedes in buying and selling shoes.

loans.use: To buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 30-year-old single woman. She has an 8-year-old child who is enrolled in school. Catherine operates a clothes retail business and sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are passersby. Catherine's other source of income is a beauty salon. She describes her greatest business challenge as being delayed payments: her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Catherine rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Catherine aspires to expand and open a boutique shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Blessing Group-Ii

texts.en:
Bintu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Bintu was born in Koidu city about 45 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Bintu sells cooked food and has been operating this business for 25 years now.

With the help of this loan, Bintu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Bintu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy cooking ingredients in bulk in order to produce more food for sale. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk in order to produce more food for sale

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 37 years old. She lives in a small village on the seaside in West Georgia. Manana is a widow who lives with her children, a 17-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son and her 71-year-old father-in-law. Her children go to school. Manana works as an office cleaner for a local company. In addition to her main job, she runs a family agricultural business with her father-in-law's help. They own an 0.2 hectare citrus garden. The family also grows maize and 100 nut trees on a family-owned 0.15 hectare of land. Manana sells harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 470 Laris, including Manana’s father-in-law's monthly pension.  

Manana has requested a loan in order to enclose the nut garden. This will protect the harvest against theft. Manana also plans to plant additional nut trees. She will sell more harvest and increase her family's income. Manana will use the increased income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a fence to enclose the nut garden

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Anexo Ajilho Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Anexo Ajilho" y se integra de  cinco personas cuatro mujeres y  un hombre  y viven en un  paraje en donde celebran la fiesta de san Andrés.

    Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Concepción quien solicito  el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra y venta de mercancía para su negocio de abarrotes en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a ido mejorando cada día más su  actividad.
 
     Ella inicio  este negocio para apoyar a su esposo  con quien lleva siete  meses de casada  y esta esperando a su primer bebe y está muy ansiosa de verlo nacer.

    Lo que mas desea es que con esta pequeña   actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando y aumente más su actividad.
 
     Quien integra en el grupo son: Anastasia quien invertirá el préstamo  en la  compra  de frutas y verduras,  Micaela  en la compra de materiales para bordar blusas de mantas,  Manuel de Jesús  invertirá en compra de  de mantas para elaborar blusas y camisas  y Amable  invertirá materiales para bordados de mantas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Anexo Ajilho" and is comprised of four women and a man who live in an area that celebrates the festivity of Saint Andrew.

Concepción is the one who was interviewed, and she is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store which she says is doing well and allowing her to improve on a daily basis.

She began the business with her husband's help.  She has been married for seven months and is expecting her first child, so she is very excited.

What she wants most to achieve with her small business is to continue working and increasing her activity.

The members of the group are: Anastasia who will invest the loan in fruits and vegetables, Micaela who will buy materials to embroider blouses and blankets, Manuel de Jesús who will buy material to make blouses and shirts and Amable who will buy materials to make embroidered blankets.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been fixing cars radiators for six years.

Mohamad is well known in his region and most of his customers are friends and relatives in addition to passers-by, since his shop in a very popular neighborhood.

Mohamad is improving his business in many different ways and as much as he can, so that it will be good enough to provide a good income for a good living.

That's why he applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy spare parts that are highly requested in his business.

Mohamad hopes to expand his business in the future and to open the wider workshop he is dreaming of having.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  Edith has a business selling bunches of bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days every week. Edith sells her products at the market by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to sell. Edith also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for bananas. Edith lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Senaval Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Senaval” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Baby is the leader of this group. She is 33 years old, married with two children who are attending primary school.  Baby sells slippers and has been operating this business for six years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying dozens of slippers for sale.

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers for sale

loans.name: Amistad ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Amistad y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad y vive en un pueblo pequeño.
 
      Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  María Dolores quien  solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes en la que comenta que lleva trabajando  unos años en donde le va bien.

     Inicio con esta actividad ya que es mujer sola ya que su esposo el abandono con sus hijos pequeños  y decidió poner una actividad en la que pudiera  sacar adelante a sus hijos.

       Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña con el préstamo ella pueda seguir incrementado más su negocio.

     Las personas quienes integran en el grupo son: Olía Marina  quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra  y venta de zapatos de la marca Andrea y c-klass, y la señora María Ángela  invertirá en la compra y venta de zapatos de la marca Andrea.
texts.en:
The group is called "Amistad" and it is comprised of three women who run different businesses in a small village.

The person interviewed was María Dolores and she is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store.  She says she has been in business for several years and it is going well.

She started the store alone since her husband left when the children were small, and she wanted a way to provide for the family.

What she desires most is for this loan to help her increase business.

The other members in the group are: Olía Marina who will invest the loan in buying and selling shoes (brands such as Andrea and C-Klass) and María Ángela who will buy and sell Andrea brand shoes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena de 50  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su esposo y un hijo. María se dedica al comercio de pupuseria y tortillería desde hace 7 años. Posee muy buenas recomendaciones y ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que la prefieren por ser una mujer honesta, responsable, carismática y muy higiénica a la hora de hacer su trabajo.  Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual se encuentra sobre la calle principal del lugar donde ella habita. Esto es una ventaja para ella ya que muchos clientes la prefieren por encontrarse en un lugar accesible y sobre todo porque ella siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y trabaja duramente para poder darles lo que necesitan. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios  como: maíz, arroz, queso, chicharon, gas propano, sal, frijoles, etc. de tal forma que pueda atraer  a más clientes que demanden sus productos y que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: María Elena, 50, lives in her own house with her family, comprised of her husband and son.  María has been in business making pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and tortillas for seven years.  She has a good reputation and many fixed customers who prefer her because of her honesty and dependability, and because she is very charismatic and hygienic in running her business.  Her stand is set up in her home which is on the main street of the town where she lives.  This is an advantage for her since the customers like the easy access and, most of all, how shes receives them with a smile and kindness.  The most important thing for her is her family and she works hard to provide them with everything they need.  Therefore she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She will buy necessary ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, pork cracklings, propane gas, salt, beans, etc. so she can attract even more customers.  This will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, cheese, pork cracklings, propane gas, salt, beans, etc.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Vaziani in East Georgia with his family: his wife, Eter, and his 29-year-old son and 21-year-old daughter. Amiran works as an operator in a local company. Eter runs the dairy farm with its two milk cows, owned by the family, which is an important source of family income along with Amiran’s salary. Eter produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris.

Amiran has requested a loan to purchase five calves. He will keep them on the farm for 5-6 months and sell them in late summer at a higher price. The family will receive additional income and will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen was born in 1961 in Yerevan. He lives with his wife and son, as his daughter is married and she lives with her husband in another country. Arsen graduated from the University of Economics and has a Masters degree in the field of Economics. He worked in different factories and companies as an economist and accountant for more than 11 years.

Since 1995, Arsen has been engaged in his own business. He started with a petrol importing business but now he is running a food and household goods trading business from the first floor of his own house which allows him to save on rent. Arsen’s wife helps him in his business and thus they provide for their family. A lot of people from Arsen’s local area prefer to buy goods from his shop as it is situated in a very convenient place and customers can always find everything for their daily needs. Arsen is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy dairy products, sunflower oil, sausages, detergents, hair dyes, etc. for his shop.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sunflower oil, sausages, detergents, hair dyes, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Sharafaddin

texts.en:
Sharafaddin is a 55-year-old man and is married with three children.  

He sells food products, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Sharafaddin has 12 years of experience in this field and considers himself a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 320 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Sharafaddin would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 2000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify with additional food stuffs. This will be his third loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: purchase additional food products

loans.name: Nukri

texts.en:
Nukri is 36 years old. He lives in a rural area near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Nukri is married and lives with his family: his wife ,Tamar, his 3-year-old son and 1-year-old daughter. Nukri and Tamar earn a living through agriculture. Nukri works hard during the whole day on the family-owned dairy farm with 10 cows. Tamar takes care of their children and also helps Nukri on the farm. They produce and sell on average 100 kg of cheese and milk in Tbilisi. Also the family has 20 sheep. They sell lambs, as well as cheese, made from sheep’s milk. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Nukri has requested a loan to purchase feed for their cows. He will use purchased feed for two months. As the cows will be fed properly, they will retain productivity and the family will get the planned amount of milk for dairy products. Starting from May, there will be fresh grass and the cows won’t need hay any more.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 58 years old. She lives in a rural area near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. She is married and lives with her big family: her husband, Venguli, two daughters (31 and 21 years old), son-in-law and mother-in-law (retired). Manana’s elder daughter works as a cashier in a local company. Her son-in-law is a worker. 

Manana and Venguli head the family's agricultural business. They run a dairy farm with four milk cows. Manana produces yogurt and sells on average 900 liters of milk and yogurt in Tbilisi. The family's total average monthly income is 1500 Laris. 

Manana requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. She will be able to increase production and sales of dairy products by 25%. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: Donald is 60 years old and does coffee farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 30 years and employs four people. To earn extra income, he does dairy farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy coffee seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old single man, who opened his own aluminum manufacturing shop 12 years ago.

Joseph is a hardworking man, who seeks perfection in his business. With fifteen years of experience, Joseph is very skilled in his domain and his customers have a high regard for the superior quality of the products he produces.

Joseph applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to update his tools and machines. He is working hard on pleasing his customers as much as he can and he is planning on buying new machines to make sure that his projects are produced in a very professional way.

This is his first cycle and he hopes his future loans will help in expanding his business more and more. Joseph has a very good reputation, which he values and strives as much as he can to keep it in good standing.

loans.use: to update his tools and machines

loans.name: Hope To God I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Hope To God I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Bintu who is 40 years old and was born in Koidu. Bintu is married to a diamond digger and the couple has five children – two in primary school, two in secondary and one not of school-going age. Bintu has been a petty trader for many years now. She sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, pepper, fish, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Bikwasire

texts.en:
Bikwasire needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

The 29-year-old, hardworking man is married and he lives in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Initially, he sold local brew and after gaining enough profits, he set up a textile shop. Customers not paying on time is his main hindrance and his dream is to expand the business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dried fish in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad, aged 24, is from Gaza; he lives with his wife and one child. Jihad has a mobile vegetable cart: he started this business on 1 January 2011. He hopes to get this loan to buy a motorcycle to facilitate the transportation process, thus he would be able to improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is a 46-year-old woman and is married with two sons. 

She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has ten years of experience and a deep knowledge of the market and client demands. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 300 AZN. Her husband helps to purchase the products and bring them to the shop. This is her family's sole source of financial income. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a 1000 AZN loan, to purchase more food products and diversify her range of goods to cover customers' demand. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 57-year-old woman and is married with five children. 

She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods in her shop. She has eight years of experience and considers herself to be a knowledgeable and skilled person. She sells detergents, as well as hair color and some cosmetic products.
 
The products she sells are very popular in Azerbaijan and go quickly from shelves. Faiza's business brings her a 230 AZN profit. It is hard to keep satisfied customers with this income, because Faiza needs to make some savings and can’t put all the income back into the business again. This is her family's only source of income. 

Faiza needs to expand her business and for this purpose she applied for a 1800 AZN loan. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop. This will be her third loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy additional detergents

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 33 years old. She lives in the village of Sartichala in East Georgia with her family: her husband, Akaki, two daughters (three and nine years old) and her mother-in-law. Natia’s oldest child goes to school. Akaki is a worker in the village. Natia’s mother-in-law works as a nurse in the village hospital. Natia runs the family's agricultural business. They have three milk cows. Natia produces cheese and sells on average 70 kg of this product to local dairy product retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Natia plans to expand her dairy farm through purchasing additional milk cows, but the current cattle shed doesn’t allow her to keep more than three cows. Taking this into account, Natia has requested a loan for the expansion of the cattle shed. When Natia increases the amount of cows on the dairy farm, she will be able to produce and sell more dairy products and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the cattle shed expansion

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 31 years old and is married with one child. He sells used shoes to earn a living, He has been in this business for six years and employs one person. To earn extra income, he sells second-hand clothes. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his child and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnuts (peanuts) and maize for planting

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old and married with four children. 

He runs a retail shop to earn a living and has been in this business for 28 years. He employs four people. To earn extra income, he does farming. 

He describes his business environment as competitive, because many people have the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, soda, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soda, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked as an electrician for twelve years. Mohamad is an expert in his field and is well known in the region. 

He wants to increase his income to provide his family with a good income and healthy lives.

Mohamad will open a charcoal selling shop, which is a good income trade these days, since charcoal is highly requested by most Hookah users and also to use as a source of heating during the cold weather.

Mohamad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to start this new business. He hopes that with this loan, he will make most of his family's dreams come true.

loans.use: To start a new charcoal selling business

loans.name: Kha

texts.en:
Kha is a 52-year-old woman. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a security guard for a local company. She has been running a clothes selling business for fifteen years. 

Kha would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to meet the needs of her existing customers better and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Newton is a married man who has seven children. He describes himself to be hard-working. Newton operates a retail store where he sells building stones and has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a competitive busy area and his primary customers are masons. 

Newton describes his biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more building stones to sell. Newton's business goal is to own a lorry within five years for delivering the stones to customers. He hopes that in the future, his business will expand.

loans.use: To buy building stones to sell.

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as quiet and kind. 

He operates a retail store, where he sells electronics, such as bulbs, cables and earth rods. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a market. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cables and earth rods. June's business goal is to expand his electonic retail shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy electronic cables and earth rods.

loans.name: Wendy Beatriz

texts.es: Wendy Beatriz de 23 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida el cual se dedica al comercio del servicio de transporte. Wendy es una joven muy carismática, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos principalmente Maíz y frijoles que son los cultivos que más se dan en su zona. Esto es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos puesto que lo que gana su esposo en transporte no alcanza a cubrir las necesidades del hogar que  cada día son mayores. Wendy ha trabajado desde hace mucho tiempo en esta actividad, la cual le ha dado muy buenos resultados. Muchas personas buscan a Wendy para solicitarle maíz o frijoles ya que ella los vende a muy buenos precios y es muy accesible con los pagos.  Tiene la duda de cómo hacer para seguir invirtiendo en este negocio en el futuro puesto que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para invertir en los insumos y en el alquiler de la tierra para seguir operando.  Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de: abonos, semilla de maíz, semilla de arroz, venenos para las plagas y alquilar de mayor cantidad de tierra para la siembra. de tal forma que pueda seguir teniendo los ingresos que hasta el momento ha recibido y que le han servido mucho para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera mejorar su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos que le permitan tener acceso a mejores condiciones de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en: Wendy Beatriz, 23 years old, lives in her own home with her partner, who works in the transport service. Wendy is a charismatic, hard-working and, above all, entrepreneurial young woman. She works in agriculture, growing mainly dry grains such as corn and beans, which are in high demand in her area. This is one of her main sources of income as her partner's wage does not cover the continually increasing expenses of running their home. Wendy has been doing this type of work for a long time, and she has achieved good results from it. Many people come to buy their corn or beans from Wendy because she sells them at a good, affordable price. She is concerned about how to continue investing in her business in the future as she does not have the necessary resources to invest in raw materials and the rent payable on the land she uses for planting. This led her to the decision to apply to INTEGRAL for this loan to invest in buying: manure, corn and rice seeds, poisons for dealing with plagues and to rent a larger portion of land for cultivation. This is so that she can continue to earn the same level of income from her work, which has worked well by allowing her to provide her family with their daily bread. She hopes to improve her income level which will allow her access to better living conditions for herself and for her family.

loans.use: To buy: manure, corn and rice seeds, and poisons for dealing with plagues, etc.

loans.name: Ignacio De Jesús

texts.es: Ignacio de Jesús habita en casa propia junto con sus hijos los cuales le ayudan a trabajar para llevar el pan de cada día  a su hogar. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz y frijoles que son los  que más se producen en la zona donde habita.  Ignacio es un hombre increíble él se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, responsable y dedicado a su familia.  La venta de los granos básicos es su principal fuente de ingresos puesto que no cuenta con otra entrada de dinero. Por muchos años él y su familia han vivido de esta forma y con la ayuda de Dios y de su trabajo ha logrado sacar lo necesario para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.  Su sueño es seguir trabajando duramente para continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar. Puesto que su familia lo es todo y es su principal  fuente de inspiración. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios (semilla de maíz, frijoles, abono, veneno para las plagas, etc.)   para cultivar la tierra y seguir cosechando los granos básicos que por mucho tiempo le han ayudado a dar a su familia  el pan de cada día. Le pide  a Dios todo poderoso que por medio de su ayuda y su trabajo pueda obtener resultados favorables que le permitan accesar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ignacio de Jesús lives in his own home with his children, who help him with his work in order to bring home their daily bread. He works in agriculture, growing dry grains such as corn and beans, which are very popular crops in his area. Ignacio is an incredible man, characterised by being hard-working, responsible and dedicated to his family. Selling these dry grains is his only source of income as there are no other earnings coming into their home. He and his family have lived this way for many years and he has managed to satisfy their needs with God's help and his own labour. His dream is to carry on working hard so that he can continue to provide for his family's daily necessities. His family mean the world to him and they are his greatest source of inspiration. He has made the decision to apply for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the necessary raw materials (corn and beans seeds, manure, poisons to deal with plagues, etc) so that he can cultivate his land and continue harvesting the dry grains, which for a long time has helped him to feed his family each day. He prays to his omnipotent Lord for favourable results which will allow him to access a better quality of life, with God's help and his own hard work.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans seeds, manure and poison to deal with plagues, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura. Cada año siembra frijoles y maíz que son los principales granos básicos que se cosechan en su zona. Luego de cosecharlos los pone a la venta y de esta forma es como va sobreviviendo y llevando  el pan de cada día a su familia. El es un hombre ejemplar ya que es muy trabajador, responsable y dedicado a su familia. Para Juan lo más importante es que su familia cuente con lo necesario para  tener una vida tranquila y en buenas condiciones. Su familia es su principal fuente de energía para seguir trabajando y  haciendo lo necesario para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los granos básicos tales como (semilla de maíz, semilla de frijol, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) además necesita el préstamo para poder seguir alquilando la tierra donde cultiva puesto que no cuenta con un terreno propio. De esta forma espera obtener resultados favorables que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo lives in his own house, together with his life partner and his children.  He dedicates himself to farming.  He plants beans and corn each year, which are the main crops grown in his zone.  He sells his products after harvesting them, and this is how he survives and provides the daily bread for his family.  He is an exemplary man as he is a hard worker, responsible, and dedicated to his family.  

The most important thing for Juan is for his family to be able to count on the things needed to live a tranquil life and under good conditions.  His family is the principal impetus for him to continue working and doing whatever is necessary to support his family and improve their standard of living.

He has made the decision to take out this loan with INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of the necessary supplies to plant his basic crops (corn seeds, bean seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.)  In addition, he needs the loan to continue renting the land where he plants, given he does not count on land of his own.  By doing these things, he hopes to obtain favorable results that will permit him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Twisungane Tudahemukirana Group

texts.fr:
Marceline fait partie du groupe Twisungane Tudahemukirana. Elle a 29 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 4 à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Il a 6 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Marceline est agricultrice de tomate. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des engrais chimique sélectionne pour augmenter la quantité ainsi que la qualité de la production. Dans les prochaines années, Marceline voudrait être la grande distributrice des tomates. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marceline is a member of the Twisungane Tudahemukirana group. She is 29 years old, and married with 3 children aged from 4 to 8, 2 of whom are in school. She has 6 other dependents apart from her children. She completed 6 years of primary school education. 
Marceline is a tomato farmer. This is her third successive loan with ACB. She will use the loan to buy chemical fertiliser. 
Her strategy for growing the business is to use specific chemical fertilisers to improve both yield and quality. In the coming years, Marceline would like to be a major tomato supplier. With her profits, she intends to care for her children and put them through school.

loans.use: To purchase chemical fertiliser

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo Antonio de 27 años de edad, habita junto a su familia. Él se dedica al comercio de computadoras, a la prestación de servicio de ciber y al mantenimiento de computadoras. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas las cuales cada día lo prefieren más, ya que es un hombre carismático, dedicado y responsable en su trabajo. Él es muy honesto y muchas personas hablan bien de él. Su familia es su prioridad y es por ella que cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para trabajar en su ciber con la esperanza que algún día sus condiciones y las de su familia se  verán mejoradas. Esto lo ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de computadoras, repuestos y accesorios. De tal forma que esto le permita atraer a más clientes que soliciten su servicio. Espera obtener resultados favorables y confía en Dios todo poderoso que con su ayuda y su trabajo todo es posible.
texts.en: Rodolfo Antonio is 27 years old and lives together with his family.  His business is selling computers, providing an Internet cafe service and fixing computers.  He has been in this business for several years and, thanks to God and his own hard work, he has managed to gain the trust of many people who have become loyal to his business because he is a charming man who is committed and responsible in his work.  He is very honest and many people speak well of him.  His family is his top priority and they are why he gets up very early every morning to work in his Internet cafe, hoping that some day his own conditions and those of his family will improve.  This has motivated him to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in his business buying computers, spare parts and accessories.  This will allow him to attract more customers.  He hopes to obtain good results and trusts in almighty God that with his help and his own work, everything is possible.

loans.use: to buy computers, spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: Jorge Armando de 28 años de edad, habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El se dedica al comercio de variedad de minutas. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas del lugar donde habita. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y es la que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos,  por lo que le pide a Dios que le ayude a seguir manteniéndolo activo por mucho más tiempo ya que su sueño es poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad y continuar brindando el pan de cada día que con mucho esfuerzo se gana. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la comprar de los insumos necesarios (frutas, jarabe, limones, leche condensada, chile, sal, hielo, etc.) para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes  y poder cubrir una  mayor demanda. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta forma logrará su objetivo de  dar a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en: Jorge Armando, 28 years of age, lives with his wife and son.  He dedicates himself to commerce, selling a variety of “minutas” (shaved ice topped with a variety of fruit syrups).  He carries out this activity as a street vendor throughout the principal zones in the area where he lives.  He has dedicated himself to this activity for various years, and it is what has allowed him to bring home income each day.  This business is his primary source of income, which is why he asks God to help him keep it active for a long time as his dream is to be able to give his family a better standard of living and provide the daily bread that he earns with much effort.  He has made the decision to take out this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in his small business and buy necessary supplies (fruits, syrups, lemons, condensed milk, chilies, salt, ice, etc.) to provide a better service for his clients and meet demand.  He trusts in almighty God that, in this manner, he will meet his goal of giving his family better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, syrups, lemons, condensed milk, chilies, salt, ice, etc.

loans.name: Télé

texts.fr:
Télé est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un imprimeur. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Télé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des friperies pour tous clients dans un  marché de la ville de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toute les demandes.
Télé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des balles de friperies. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Télé voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Télé is a 44 year old woman. She is married to a printer. She has 2 children. Télé has worked as a retailer since 2000. She sells secondhand clothing to all types of customers in a market in the city of Lomé. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone.
Her biggest current difficulty is not being able to meet all the demand she has. Télé is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to purchase bundles of secondhand clothes. She wishes to invest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to increase the scale of her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: María Iduvina

texts.es: María Iduvina 53  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y su  hija.  María  es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Para María no hay obstáculo que le impida realizar sus tareas diarias. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venda    de prendas de vestir como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y uniformes para las diferentes escuelas dentro de la zona.  Esta actividad la realiza  en su hogar de habitación, lugar donde elabora las diferentes prendas de vestir y luego las distribuye en las zonas de donde se  las han encargado.  Además ha adecuado su casa para realizar las ventas de  algunos de sus artículos cuando ella se encuentra en casa. En fin María  es una mujer ejemplar que con su arduo trabajo y dedicación se ha ganado la confianza de todos los clientes,  los cuales cada día la prefieren más. María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra  de la materia prima como: telas, hilos, elástico, tijeras, botones, etc. Todo esto con el objetivo de mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos que le permitan aspirar a mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: María Iduvina is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her family, which is comprised of her husband and daughter.  María is a woman who is a fighter, hard working and, most of all, an entrepreneur.  There is no obstacle that will prevent María from carrying out her daily tasks.  She dedicates herself to making and selling clothing such as: skirts, pants, blouses, dresses, and uniforms for the different schools within the zone.  She carries out this activity from her home, the place where she makes her clothing and later distributes them to areas from which they were ordered.  In addition, she has outfitted her house to sell some of her articles from when she is home.  In short, María is an exemplary woman who, with hard work and dedication, has won the confidence of her customers who each day prefer her more.  María has made the decision to request this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business and buy raw materials such as: fabrics, threads, elastic, scissors, buttons, etc.  She does all this with the objective of improving her sales levels and the income that allows her to aspire to provide a higher quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy: fabrics, threads, elastic, scissors, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr:
Khadim a ouvert sa boutique il y a de cela 10 ans. Il vend des denrées alimentaires. Mais en dehors de cela, il part dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour acheter des céréales, du tamarin et d’autres produits alimentaires. Il peut soit les exposer à sa boutique, soit le revendre à des marchandes ambulantes de la place.
Khadim est âgé de 51 ans, marié et père de famille. Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Comme projet futur, il voudrait agrandir sa boutique en un magasin.
texts.en: Khadim opened his small shop 10 years ago. He sells foodstuffs. But in addition to that, he goes to weekly markets to buy cereals, tamarinds and other food products. He either puts them out for sale in his shop, or sells them to local mobile sellers. Khadim is 51 years old, married and a father. The income from his business allows him to meet the family's living expenses. As a future project, he would like to increase the size of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est célibataire.
Koffi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des poissons frits pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits au Bénin. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons frits. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Koffi is a 26 year old single man. He has been working as a retailer since 2010. He sells fried fish door-to-door to all types of customer. He buys his products in Benin. He works alone. At the moment his biggest problem is running out of stock. Koffi is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to buy fried fish. He wants to invest in his activity. In the coming years, Koffi would like to grow his business. He says that with his profits, he intends to meet the family household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fried fish

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un infirmier. Elle a 1 enfant. 
Ama travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits viviers pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Vogan. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, de la pate de manioc et divers autres produits vivriers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ama is a 39 year old woman. She is married to a nurse. She has 1 child. Ama has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells staple food products to a variety of customers door-to-door. She buys her products in Vogan. Her biggest problem at the moment is running out of stock. Ama is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to buy corn, cassava paste and other staples. She wants to invest in her activity. In the coming years, Ama would like to grow her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to take care of the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase staple food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flours, milk, sugar, cinnamon, corn, colorings, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Domingo Bautista

texts.es: Domingo Bautista de 37 años de edad, habita junto a su familia. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol. Tiene varios años de dedicarse  a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia. Es muy conocido en la zona donde habita ya que él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honesto, responsable y muy colaborador. La siembra de los granos básicos la realiza en una parcela que año con año alquila a uno de sus vecinos. De esta forma es como el señor Domingo se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su sueño es continuar dando a su familia lo necesario para que pueda ir sobreviviendo y no pierde las esperanzas de que algún día sus oportunidades de vida se vean mejoradas. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para el cultivo (venenos, abonos, semilla, etc.)  y para el alquiler de su parcela, de tal forma que pueda seguir operando durante el año. No pierde la fe que de esta forma logrará su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Domingo Bautista, 37 years of age, lives with his family.  He dedicates himself to growing basic grains such as: corn and beans.  He has dedicated himself to this activity for various years, therefore he now has a great deal of experience.  He is well known in the zone where he lives for being a hard working, honest and responsible man, as well as very collaborative.  He plants his crops on a parcel of land that he rents year-to-year from one of his neighbors.  This is how Domingo makes a living, and generates daily income for his home.  His dream is to continue providing what’s necessary for his family to survive, and he never loses the hope that one day his life’s opportunities will improve.  He has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of the necessary supplies for farming (insecticides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.) and to rent his parcel of land so he can continue to operate during the year.  He does not lose faith that, in this manner, he will reach his dream of improving his and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a twenty-five-year-old married woman. She has a child who is three years old and is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hassan. 

Mwanatumu operates a restaurant business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high competition and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mwanatumu will use the KES 20,000 loan to renovate her restaurant and purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam, fifty-one years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. Lam supports her family with the income that she earns selling sweet soup. 

Lam intends to use her loan to buy more good quality materials to make sweet soup. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more good quality ingredients to make her sweet soup.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a forty-year-old woman with two sons. Her husband has been working as a driver. Huong lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks and providing a parking service.

For the past eight years, she has run a food stall and provides a parking service to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kind of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a forty-three-year-old married man with three children. Her husband has been working as a driver. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thao has been running a food stall for nearly six years. She sells noodles to people in the local community. She intends to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a fifty-eight-year-old divorced woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. Hong has three daughters. 

Hong has been in the business of manufacture hammocks for thirty-two years. She plans to use this loan to buy a higher quality and a greater quantity of ropes for producing hammocks  

In the future, Hong would like to expand her business to increase her income for raising her children and give them a good education.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and higher quality of ropes for producing hammocks.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a thirty-seven-year-old single woman. She has a child who is seven years old and is enrolled in school. Racheal operates a retail shop where she sells her goods. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be high cost of commodities and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Racheal will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

Racheal aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh, forty-nine, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have supported their family by selling bedding at their house for ten years. They sell items such as mattresses, blankets, and camp beds. 

Khanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of bedding items to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of bedding items.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, forty-eight, is widowed and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Mai supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business four years ago. 

Mai sells shampoo, dish-washing liquid soap and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of basic products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of basic products to stock in her general store.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is from the village of Charnali, West Georgia. He is forty-seven years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife – Izolda, his twenty-four-year-old son, twenty-one-year-old daughter and his father who is retired. Roman’s son works as accountant in a local company. Roman works as a driver in another private company and gets a monthly salary. Along with his main job, Roman is involved in the family's agricultural business, which is led by Izolda. They have 0.4 hectares of land, where various fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold on the local open market to greengrocery retailers. The average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris.

Roman requested credit to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse. In the greenhouse he will be able to grow vegetables throughout the year and the family will get income from sales in all seasons. The average monthly income of the family will increase. Roman plans to reinvest part of the additional profit in the further development of family farm and the other part will be used to improve the family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet, a 50 year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells clothes-making materials to people in the local community. Tuyet requests a loan to purchase a greater quantity of cotton fibres to stock her store. This will enable her to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of cotton fibres to stock her store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel used to deal in nursery beds where he got money to buy a motorcycle that he now uses for his transport business.For the three years that he has been in this sector, he has a hardship of high fuel cost and his dreams are building a house, educating his children, and diversifying his business to include farming activities. Emmanuel needs the loan facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, aged 32, is a single man who repairs cars. He has been doing this for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 37,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to purchase screw drivers and spanners. Gilbert hopes to own a garage in future.

loans.use: To buy tools like screw drivers and spanners.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert Karisa is 44 years old and a businessman in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is married. He runs a welding workshop, a business he has been operating for the past ten years. His business is doing great.
