texts.es:
Santos tiene 62 años de edad, es conviviente y vive con su pareja y su nieta en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de personas en la zona, él se dedica a la agricultura.  Trabaja en un terreno (2.50 ha), allí siembra limón, el cual cosecha semanalmente. Esta actividad le permite agenciarse de ingresos con los cuales se encarga del mantenimiento de su familia. Adicionalmente vende animales menores, cuando estos alcanzan el peso ideal en el mercado de su localidad.

Santos desea que su cultivo tenga una buena producción, por ello trabaja arduamente para lograr su objetivo. Actualmente desea adquirir abonos y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y para ayudarse, ha decidido  solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Santos es alguien conocido en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es tener éxito en su actual cosecha y en las cosechas futuras para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 62, lives with his spouse and granddaughter in Tambogrande District, a district primarily dedicated to growing fruit for export to other countries.  It belongs to Piura Province in the region of the same name located over three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Like most people in the area, he’s a farmer.  He works a parcel of land (2.5 hectares) where he grows lemons that are harvested weekly.  This activity allows him to earn income to support his family.  He also sells small farm animals in his local market when they reach ideal weight.

Santos wants his crops to produce well so he works hard to reach this objective.  He currently wants to buy manure and pesticide to provide crop maintenance and to help him do so, he’s decided to request his first, 1200 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is well-known in the area; his neighbors consider him to be a hardworking, responsible person.  His greatest hope is to be successful with is current crop and in future harvests in order to move his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy crop fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa familiar con su conviviente y su hijo, además de sus suegros. La casa está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte céntrica del distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la venta de gaseosas, jugos y postres en propio domicilio en el cual atiende permanentemente y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona, Su conviviente es trabajador estable en una fábrica y le pagan semanalmente.  Ambos cooperan para el sostenimiento de la familia.
María desea comprar calaminas para mejorar el techado de su casa, que se han deteriorado por las constantes lluvias.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maria, 22, lives in her in-laws’ house along with her common-law-husband and their one son.  The house is in the Tambogrande district in the central area and it has basic services.
She sells soft drinks, juices and desserts from her own house where she is always available  to take care of customers and has an established customer base in the area.  Her husband has a regular job in a factory and receives a weekly salary.  They both work to cover the family expenses.
Maria wants to buy corrugated metal to improve the roof of her house because it has deteriorated from the constant rain.  That is why she decided it would be good to get a loan of 1500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to improve the roof of her house

loans.name: Elioberta

texts.en:
Elioberta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. 

Elioberta has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish for selling.

Elioberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elioberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish for selling

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 57 years old from Olkalou, and is married to Esther. They have one child, who is in school.

John has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to boost his farming methods, be the top farmer in the Olkalou area and use his income to increase his living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 49 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Ignatio, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been a farmer for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Anastasia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to venture into dairy keeping.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nicolette

texts.ru:
Николет вложила предыдущий кредит в приобретение лазерно-звукового оборудования для проведения косметических процедур для кожи лица. Она также перешла из одного салона красоты в другой, который находится в центре города, в следствие чего сменилась и увеличилась клиентура. 
Николет хочет вложить кредит КИВА в приобретение новейших косметических средств по уходу за телом, волосами и кожей для последующей реализации их у себя в салоне во время предоставления разного рода косметических услуг. Она закупила качественные кремы, маски, скрабы, тонизирующие средства, чтобы ее клиенткам не нужно было искать подходящую косметику где-то за рубежом, а можно было приобрести необходимые продукты на месте.
texts.en: Nicolette invested her previous loan into a purchase of a sound-laser equipment for cosmetic procedures for facial skin.  She also moved from one beauty salon to another, located in the city center, due to which her clientele changed and grew.  Nicolette wants to invest the Kiva loan into a purchase of the latest body, hair and skin cosmetic treatments to resell at her salon while providing various types of cosmetic service.  She bought quality creams, masks, scrubs, and toners so that her clients did not have to search for suitable cosmetics somewhere abroad and could buy necessary products in one place.

loans.use: to purchase the latest body, hair and skin cosmetic treatments to resell at her salon

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca, es madre soltera, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes junto a su hijo que tiene 14 años de edad quien está cursando sus estudios actualmente.
Doña francisca es muy emprendedora ella siempre quiso trabajar en lo propio y con muchos esfuerzos logro establecerlo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la elaboración de queso, mantequilla, cuajada y otros.
Trabaja todo el día realizando esta actividad.
Ella  ha mantenido su negocio con préstamos, actualmente solicita el  cuarto préstamo a ODEF, para invertirlo en la compra de leche, cuajo, sal y otros insumos para elaborar queso, mantequilla, cuajada, etc. 
Su meta es mantener siempre la materia prima para su negocio y mantener su clientela.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother who lives in a village in the San Pedro Sula municipality in Cortes.  She lives with her 14 year old son, and he goes to school.

Francisca is very enterprising.  She always wanted to work on her own, and with a great deal of effort she managed to establish her own business.  For several years she has been making cheese, butter, curds, and others.  She works all day at this business activity.

She has continued with her business with loans.  She is currently requesting her fourth loan with ODEF.  She will use it to buy milk, curds, salt, and other supplies to make cheese, butter, and curds, etc.

Her goal is to always have the raw materials for her business on hand and to keep her clientele.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business like milk, curds, salt, and other supplies to make cheese, butter, and curds, etc.

loans.name: Nana

texts.fr:
Madame Nana est une femme mariée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Niebala de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 6ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle décida d’apprendre les activités génératrices de revenus.
C’est ainsi qu’elle suivra sa sœur pour apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente de chaussures et d’habits.
Avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans, elle maitrise cette activité et est très sollicitée et appréciée à Bougouni. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle intègre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à sa premier prêt.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 3 douzaines de vêtements pour femme, 2 pièces de tissus et  1 douzaine de chaussures.
 Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et à Bamako, elle revend ses produits en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni et à domicile, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Nana is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Niebala neighborhood of Bougouni.

Having left school at the level of the 6th year (Malian education system), she decided to gain some experience in income-generating activities. Following the footsteps of her sister, she became involved in buying and selling shoes and clothes.  She now has over 20 years of experience in this field and manages her business well.  She is very valued and very much in demand in Bougouni.  In order to meet the needs of her customers who are becoming more demanding and whose numbers are increasing, she has joined Soro Yiriwaso.  This is her first loan.

With this loan, she is planning to purchase 3 dozen outfits for women, 2 sets of fabrics and one dozen shoes.

She stocks up in Burkina Faso and in Bamako.  She resells her merchandise door-to-door in the various neighborhoods of Bougouni, and also from her home.  Her customers are mostly women.

With this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 45,000 CFA francs.  With these profits, she is planning to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy various items such as women's clothing, fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar Alberto tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y a la venta de  naranjilla, además cría animales como los cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos,semillas, fertilizantes,  líquidos para la maleza y comprar polvillo.  Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para mejorar la producción.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda  semanalmente. El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para transportar los  productos que cosecha.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Cesar Alberto is 21 years old. He is single, he has no children, and he lives with his parents in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

He is a member of the Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, the community is found about 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Martha, belonging to the canton of Guaranda.

Cesar works in agriculture, sowing and selling naranjilla. In addition, he raises animals such as pigs. He requests the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, liquid weed killers, and to buy animal feed. With the money from the loan he'll be able to buy fertilizers to improve his production.

He does his buying and selling in Guaranda once a week. His dream is to be able to buy a vehicle to transport his products that he harvests. The challenges facing him are plagues and bad weather. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer and enjoy local festivals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, liquid weed killers, and animal feed.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.es:
Teodulo tiene 50 años de edad de estado civil viudo, con 2 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza, en Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la comunidad, el caserío es pequeño y los habitantes son muy tratables.
Se dedica a la producción y venta de plátanos de seda desde hace 7 años, además se dedica  al sembrío de maíz y frejol.
Teodulo desea comprar urea y sus derivados para darle mantenimiento a su parcela ya que es la época de la plaga en la zona, además una parte del crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en el sembrío de maíz, para que de esa manera tenga mejores  ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida.  Es por ello que ha considerado conveniente obtener un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles.
El mercado es potencial para este tipo de cultivo, ya que la zona es conocida mayormente por la producción de plátanos y el sembrío de maíz y otros derivados. Para ello necesita invertir y así tenga buenas utilidades en un corto plazo.
El objetivo principal del cliente es producir buenos plátanos y venderlos a un buen precio dentro de pocos meses, para ello se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar su meta, y trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y lo hace con mucha responsabilidad, además es muy conocido en la zona.
texts.en:
Teodulo, 50, is a widower with 2 children in his care.  He lives in his own home in the Matanza district of Piura, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo.  He has good work and personal references in his community, which is a small rural settlement where the residents are very congenial.

Teodulo has been cultivating and selling yellow bananas for 7 years.  He also cultivates corn and beans.

Teodulo wants to buy urea and its derivatives to use in maintaining his parcel of land, because this is the season for crop diseases in his area.  In addition, he will invest part of this loan in the cultivation of corn, so that he can have a better income and thus a better quality of life.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles.

The market has good potential for investment in this type of crop, because this area is known mainly for its production of bananas, corn, and other crops.  So to take advantage of this, he needs to invest.  This way, he will have better profits in the near term.

Teodulo's main goal is to produce good bananas and sell them at a good price within a couple of months.  To do this, he will exert himself to the maximum to reach this goal, working every day from the very early hours, and working responsibly.  Also, he is very well known in the area.

loans.use: to buy urea and its derivatives to maintain his parcel of land

loans.name: Tausi Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early 40s, is single with one child, who is still going to school. He has been selling secondhand shoes for 20 years now. He works from 8.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shoes' stock, buy a shamba, buy a motorcycle and pay for household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more stock of secondhand shoes to resell. His dream is to one day be able to buy another motorcycle and a car.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Tausi", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of secondhand shoes to resell

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep, 64, is a responsible and diligent mother who resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is married and has six children, four of whom are married and two of whom are single. Tep describes herself as a humble farmer. However, she will always strive to work to uplift her family from hunger and poverty. Besides rice husbandry, Tep operates a pig-raising business at home for extra income. 

At present, she would like a loan from HKL to purchase a plowing machine for use on her farmland. These funds will enable Tep to develop her current business. She is very happy and appreciative of the great support from our generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine for use on her farmland.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 60 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Monica, a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He has been in a farming business for the past 14 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan unsuccessfully due to crop diseases, which affected all his crops. Bernard will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is 43 years old and has 4 children. She is married and has 1 child in school.

Daniela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daniela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Daniela has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Daniela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Gleceria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Gleceria would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 04  hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Juan Velasco Alvarado del Distrito de Tambogrande.  Vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Víctor se dedica a la agricultura, contando a la fecha con 1,50 has de terreno sembrado de limón y mango; además de productos de pan llevar.  Su esposa cuenta con una bodega donde atiende todos los días y ambos se apoyan mutuamente.  Los ingresos que perciben de las actividades a las que se dedican, los invierten en sus gastos personales y en los gastos familiares. 

Víctor desea comprar fertilizantes y realizar labores de poda y deshierbo en sus terrenos, asimismo invertirá en compra de agua para riego del cultivo, así se lograra una mejor cosecha de sus productos y venderlos a un mejor precio.  Para lograr su objetivo, Víctor ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Víctor is 39 years old, married and has four children under his care. He lives in his own home in the hamlet of Juan Velasco Alvarado in a rural part of the district of Tambogrande that only has basic electrical service. Victor makes a living in agriculture, and has to date 1.5 hectares of land planting lemons and mangoes. His wife has a convenience store that she tends to every day, and they support each other. They take the profits from their businesses and use them for personal and household expenses. Victor wishes to purchase fertilizers and hire workers for pruning and weeding his land, as well as purchase irrigation water for his crops. In this way he will be able to have a better harvest and sell his products at a better price. Victor is requesting a loan to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire workers.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery in the Philippines.

Anecita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. She is single and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothing like blankets, pants and other clothing.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like blankets, pants and other items

loans.name: Dora  Elia

texts.es: La señora Dora es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable , a lo largo de los créditos  que a  tenido en la  institución se  ha  caracterizado  por tener  un excelente  cultura  de pagos, lo cual  nos  da  la oportunidad  de  apoyarla  en los  diferentes  proyectos  que  tiene, es  por  ella  que  en esta  ocasión requiere  de  nuestra  ayuda  para  construir  un cuarto de lavado  en su  vivienda,  ya que  nos comenta  que  en  temporadas  de  invierno  se  ha  enfermado en varias  ocasiones  ya que  tiene  que  salir   al patio,  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de hacer  su  sueño  una realidad  por lo que  se  encuentra  muy  contenta.
texts.en: Dora is a very hardworking and responsible person. Throughout the loans she has had with the institution, she has distinguished herself for having an excellent repayment record. This allows us to support her in her various projects, and that is why on this occasion she requests our help in order to build a laundry room in her home. She reports that she has gotten ill on numerous occasions during wintertime, since she has to go out in the backyard. She sees the loan as a possibility to make her dream a reality, and she is very happy for that.

loans.use: to build a laundry room.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old farmer. She is married to Tarsicio, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 15 years with a monthly income of KES 18,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced to it by a KADET staff member. Agnes will use the loan to buy animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 33 years old and single. She works very hard.

Cecile runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a large quantity of merchandise for her store.

Cecile has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Cecile would like to save enough money to build a grocery in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 64 years old and married with seven children. He runs a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years and has employed five people. He describes his customers as low-income earners because they live in the slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
Vena is 27 years old, married, and has two children. With one child in school, Vena works very hard to provide for her family.

Vena runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.  She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Vena would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old, married, and has three children who all currently go to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena has a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as canned goods, detergent, and other groceries to sell. Rowena has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, detergent, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old. She is a married woman and has 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merlinda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Merlinda has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Resse

texts.en:
Resse works hard to support her family. Resse is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Resse requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs and dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Resse has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Resse would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and dried fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: 1 De Mayo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 1 de Mayo está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por la parroquia de Cumbe que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca. En su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y al comercio. Las socias son mujeres que laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Ellas mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Karina, tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 4 años de edad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá pero de manera independiente.

La Señora. Karina se dedica al comercio desde hace 5 años, vende ropa de todo tipo en los días de ferias. También tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 2 años, en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "1 de Mayo" is made up of 6 female members and one male member who live in Cumbe parish, which is found in the southern part of the city of Cuenca. In the surrounding area, large pastures belonging to livestock ranches are found; some are old haciendas and others are modern constructions. The people belonging to the communal bank work raising animals, in agriculture, and in business. The female members are women who work in different economic activities, the very ones that allow them to improve their household finances. These women uphold the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the female members of this group is Karina, who is 23 years old. She is married and has a 4-year-old daughter with her husband. Her husband works in construction as a mason. They don't have their own house so they live with her mother, but in an independent manner.

Karina has been working in business for 5 years. She sells all kinds of clothing on market days. She has also had a food store for 2 years, where she works from Sunday to Sunday from 6 in the morning to 10 at night.

The communal bank finds itself in its second loan cycle, and she will invest the new loan in buying products which are basic necessities to supply her store. Her goal is to have her own house.
 
The small photograph is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy products that are basic necessities.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, curls, and groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to build new house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Doyien

texts.en:
Doyien is 32 years old, married and has 1 kid, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Doyien has a general store business in the Philippines. Doyien requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Doyien has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Doyien would like to build a grocery store and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 26 years old and married with 2 children. He runs a barber shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 6 years and has employed 2 people. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Daniel has been able to grow his business and hopes to open another barber shop in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Ahuehuete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Ahuehuete, está conformado por la señora Marina va a comprar con su prestamos sabritas, refrescos, huevo, leche, la señora Gina Rebeca va a comprar refacciones para su taxi, la señora Emilia va a comprar harina, soya, el señor Esteban va a comprar refrescos, sabritas y dulces. 
La señora Marina tiene 37 años de edad ella es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1 varón,   su hija más pequeña está estudiando la secundaria,  los otros dos son mayores de edad ya no estudian, de hecho ella fue mamá muy joven.
Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito  su préstamo para comprar leche, aceite, jabón, frijol, arroz, azúcar, detergente, huevo, refresco, sabritas, galletas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, le ofrecieron el local prestado y lo tomo. Su negocio es importante por porque es el sustento para los gastos de la casa como la luz, gas, agua, a ella le gusta cuando van los clientes a comprar sus productos, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su tienda cuando necesita algo  o hay una emergencia tiene de donde tomar, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio meter legumbres y frutas, su negocio le ayudado económicamente para la escuela de su hija. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener bien surtida la tienda y apoyar a su hija para que siga estudiando y logre una carrera. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva  a Fundación Realidad “gracias por el apoyo que nos brindan con su préstamos podemos crecer los negocios”.
texts.en: The Ahuehuete group consists of Marina, who plans to use the loan to purchase chips, beverages, eggs, milk and other items; Gina Rebeca, who plans to use it to purchase spare parts for her taxi; Emilia, who plans to purchase flour and soy beans; and Esteban, who plans to purchase beverages, chips and candies. Marina is a 37-year-old single mother of three children, two girls and a boy. Her youngest daughter is in high school, and the eldest two are adults and no longer in school due to the fact she was a very young mother. Marina has a grocery store, and she is requesting the loan to purchase milk, oil, ham, beans, rice, sugar, detergents, eggs, beverages, chips and cookies. She started the business 10 years ago when she was offered to rent a store front, and she accepted. Her business is important because it pays the bills, like electric, gas and water services. She enjoys when customers purchase her products and she feels proud of having a store where someone can come when they need something or when there's an emergency. She is planning to expand her business by adding fruits and legumes. The business has helped her afford her daughter's education. Her hopes and dreams are to have a well-stocked store and support her youngest daughter earn a degree. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and partner Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the support you provide us with the loans so we can grow our businesses."

loans.use: to purchase milk, oil, ham, beans, rice, sugar, detergent, eggs, beverages, chips, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 60 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more goods to sell. Felisa has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.  Felisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Copala Group

texts.es:
Francisca cuenta con 52 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos con ella un esta Maria concepción solo estudio hasta el bachiller y Eduardo tiene 19 años de edad también ya solo se quedo con el bachiller no pudo estudiar mas porque lo tiene la solvencia económica para sus estudios.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende tamales de mole de pollo ya tiene 40 años que esta con ese negocio y dice que es muy buen negocio vende todos los días  en su pueblo donde dice que los termina todos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumo que utiliza como son: chile, masa, hojas de plátano para la envoltura, pollo, etc. ella espera que le vaya muy bien porque es una fuente de ingresos para la los gastos de su familia e ir creciendo el negocio esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado.

Francisca pertenece al grupo cópala cuyo nombre es porque en la comunidad donde viven se da el mucho el copal, el grupo esta integrado por 10 señoras trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Eduarda, Rubisela, Marlene, Ma Lucas, Celerina, Alicia, María de los Ángeles, Yesenia, Francisca, todas tienen una actividad comercial como son: venta de productos de abarrotes, comida, perfumes, quesos, tamales, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca is 52 years old and a single mother. She has two children who live with her: Maria Concepción, who studied only through high school, and Eduardo, age 19, who also stopped with his high school degree; he could not study further because he does not have the economic resources for his studies. 

Francisca works selling chicken mole tamales. She has done this work for 40 years, and she says it is a very good business. She sells her goods every day in her village, and she says that she always sells out. She will invest her loan in buying the supplies that she uses, such as chilies, corn masa, banana leaves for the wrappers, chicken, etc. She hopes that it will go well for her, and her business will grow, since it is a source of income for her family's expenses. She is grateful for the support provided to her. 

Francisca belongs to the Cópala group, which has that name because in the community where they live, a lot of copal is produced. The group is made up of 10 hard-working women, as follows: Eduarda, Rubisela, Marlene, Ma Lucas, Celerina, Alicia, María de los Ángeles, Yesenia and Francisca. All of them have a commercial activity, such as selling grocery products, food, perfumes, cheeses, tamales, etc.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she uses, such as chilies, corn masa, banana leaves for wrappers, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Yambio. She has a food stall and has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school.

Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, detergent powder, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to build a grocery at the public market.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, detergent powder, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is married and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, and she is 38 years old.

Loreta has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment.  She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Loreta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years old and married.  She has two children, one of whom is in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  Dolores has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as mineral water, sardines, snack foods, sugar, etc.  In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Las Chaparritas Group

texts.es:
Lilia cuenta con 48 años de edad  es madre soltera tiene hijos los cuales son una esta estudiando Karen Yasmín estudia psicología, Juan José cuenta con 25 años de edad y Ana Lilia 28 años aun esta con su mama y la apoyan económicamente.

Ella es comerciante tiene un club de desayunos productos  herbalife dice que le va muy bien ella espera que le vaya mejor ya que le gustaría establecer otro club en otro lugar y así ir creciendo el negocio  ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mas productos de herbalife para su club como son: malteadas, te de diferentes sabores, espera que le vaya muy bien con el negocio y hacer lo que tanto le gustaría incrementar el negocio un poco mas.

Lilia pertenece al grupo las chaparritas el cual esta integrado por 11 señoras trabajadoras las cuales todas cuenta con un negocio a continuación serán mencionadas: Adela, Jovita, Rosa, Andrea Guadalupe, Gloria, Yesenia, Bertha, Amelia, Josefina, Ma de Jesús, todas tienen una actividad comercial como son. Venta de ropa, frutas y verduras, dulces, productos naturista, perfumes, productos de abarrotes, pescadería, etc.
texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and a single mother. Her children are Karen Yasmín, who studies psychology, Juan José, who's 25 years old, and Ana Lilia, who's 28 years old and still lives with her mom. They support her financially.
She's in sales. She has a breakfast club with Herbalife products and she says that it's going very well. She hopes that it gets better, because she would like to set up the club somewhere else and therefore expand the business. She will use the loan to purchase more Herbalife products for her club, such as shakes and tea of various flavors. She hopes that her business works out well and that she can do what she would very much like to do, which is to improve her business a little.
Lilia is a member of the "Las Chaparritas" communal bank, which is comprised of 11 hardworking ladies. All of them run businesses and they will be mentioned as follows: Adela, Jovita, Rosa, Andrea Guadalupe, Gloria, Yesenia, Bertha, Amelia, Josefina, Ma de Jesús. All of them own business activities such as selling clothing, fruits and vegetables, sweets, healthfood products, perfumes, groceries, fish, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more Herbalife products for her club, such as shakes and tea of various flavors.

loans.name: Arketha

texts.en:
Arketha lives in Yambio. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school.

Arketha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil conviviente con 3 hijos a su cargo.  Vive con su familia en casa propia y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, en Morropón, correspondiente a Piura, ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  La comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores son muy amables con los visitantes.
Alejandro se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, además de dedicarse a la agricultura desde hace 5 años en su localidad.
Alejandro quiere invertir en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de maíz, para el arreglo de corral y para dar mantenimiento a su parcela de frejol, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la comunidad.  Es por ello que ha creído necesario obtener un préstamo de 2010 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
El mercado es bueno para la crianza y venta de animales, pues la población en su mayoría se dedica a este tipo de negocio y sobre todo se cuidan mutuamente y eso es de influencia para que los  crianderos de la zona  inviertan y perciban utilidades en corto plazo.
Alejandro trabaja con responsabilidad, además es muy responsable y amable en su labor.
texts.en: Alejandro is 43 years old, married and has three children. He has good personal and professional references. He lives in his own home with his family in Morropón, about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. The community is small and the people are very friendly to visitors. Alejandro has made a living in farming and raising and selling small animals for the past five years. He wants to invest in his business. Specifically, he wants to purchase corn, to fix his corrals and to maintain his bean crops. In this way he can increase his profits, provide for his family and improve their quality of life. This is why he is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. It is a good market for raising and selling animals since the majority of the population works in this type of business and everyone looks out for each other. This encourages livestock raisers to invest in the area and receive short-term profits. Alejandro takes a lot of responsibility in his work.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fix his corrals and maintain his bean crops.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Teresa requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Umubano N0 2 Group

texts.fr:
Claude fait partie du groupe Umubano No 2. Il a 47 ans et il est marié, avec 7 enfants de 8 ans à 22 ans, dont 7 scolarises. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Claude est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Claude voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Claude is part of the Umubano No 2 group. He is 47 years old and is married, with 7 children from 8 to 22 years old, of whom 7 are in school. He has one dependent other than his children. His level of education is 6 years of primary school.

Claude is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

His strategy to grow his business is to use a better type of seeds. In the coming years, Claude would like to be a great farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Cefriana

texts.en:
Cefriana is 46 years old, married, and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Cefriana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. Cefriana has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending and buying and selling firewood.

Cefriana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Kpemahouton Group

texts.fr: Le groupement KPEMAHOUTON est composé de onze personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et exercent des activités génératrices de revenu au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Bella est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Bella est âgée de 33 ans, et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Hillaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. Bella n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Bella vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis douze ans, Bella vend de la farine de manioc et de façon secondaire de l’huile de palme et de maïs dans un marché du Benin. Bella s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Bella et les autres membres du groupement KPEMAHOUTON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle et par la suite augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The KPEMAHOUTON is comprised of eleven people all living in the same neighborhood and performing profit-generating activities in Benin. The representative of the group, Bella, is the one pictured with her hand raised.
  
Bella is 33 years old, and is married to a driver named Hillaire.  The couple has four children, all of whom are dependents and some are attending school.  Bella did not attend school.  Bella lives together with her husband and children, and shares the responsibility of providing for the various household needs.

For twelve years, Bella has been selling cassava flour as well as palm and corn oils on the side out of a market in Benin.  Bella stocks up in a region of Benin.

This is the second time that Bella and the other members of the KPEMAHOUTON group have asked for a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in oder to better respond to the demands of the clientele, which will lead to growth in their profits. The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase 8 drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Barrio Tepeyac Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Barrio Tepeyac" y esta conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras  con las fuerzas de hacer crecer su negocio.
Son originarias de un pueblo pequeño llamado el cerro de la esperanza  donde al entrar al pueblo hay muchos huertos de papaya  y árboles de mango ,la mayoría de las hombres  de cerro de la esperanza se dedican a la siembra de maíz y  papaya y las mujeres a la venta de pollo, tamales y comida.
Una de las integrantes  del grupo es la señora Rosario una señora trabajadora y alegre que se dedica a la venta de pollos, quesos y pan desde  hace un año seis  meses.
Doña Chayo como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  nos cuenta como es que ha  obtenido sus tres negocios y hacerlo crecer cada día mas.
Ella nos dice que  primero empezó  a comprar una media  caja de pollos y salía  las calles de su localidad a ofrecer su pollo ya que  de sus ganancias ahorrada para poder comprar  ingredientes para la elaboración de pan  ya que desde   que tenia quince años  sabia hacer pan  y la llenaba de alegría saber que seria otro negocio y tendría mas ganancias para darle una mejor vida a su hijo Kevin de siete años de edad.
Doña Chayo nos dice que  cada tercer día de la semana se dedica a la elaboración de quesos ya que le gusta mucho  cuajar la leche y ponerle sal a la guajada para que sus quesos salgan bien de sal y no salados.
Doña Chayo va invertir el crédito  para  comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de pan  como es : harina,leche,levadura,hueva,roya,manteca y mantequilla .
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado para  que sus negocios crezcan y puedan darle una mejor vida a sus familias.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Ocotlan-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Andrea –quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Gloria-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Le dan las  gracias a fundacion por ayuda  que les ha dado ya que desean mejor su comunidad con mas pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Barrio Tepeyac" and it's comprised of four hardworking women with the strength to expand their businesses.
They come from a small village called El Cerro de la Esperanza. Going into the village there are a lot of papaya gardens and mango trees. Most of the men in Cerro de la Esperanza sow corn and papayas, and the women sell chicken, tamales and food.
One of the group members is Rosario, a hardworking and cheerful lady who has been selling chicken, cheese and bread for a year and a half.
Doña Chayo, as she is known to her fellow group members, tells us how she got her three businesses started and made them grow on a daily basis.
She says that at first she started to buy half a box of chicken and go out to sell it on the streets of her village. She saved her profits in order to buy supplies for baking bread, because she has known how to bake bread since she was 15. She was filled with joy to know that it would be another business and that she would get more profits so that she could improve her 7-year-old son Kevin's living conditions.
Doña Chayo tells us that on the third day of every week she makes cheese. She very much enjoys curdling the milk and putting salt in the curd so that her cheese gets enough, but not too much salt.
Doña Chayo will use the loan to purchase more supplies for baking bread, such as flour, milk, yeast, eggs, baking powder and butter.
She gives thanks to the Fundación for the support it has provided so that they can expand their businesses and improve their families' living conditions.
The other members of the group are:
Ocotlan, who sells antojitos (a typical Mexican snack);
Andrea, who sells perfumes;
Gloria, who sells groceries.
They give thanks to the Fundación for the help they have been given, because they wish to improve their community with more small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to bake bread.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with five children. Her husband works as a farmer. She lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol with her family.

Maria has been in the business of raising pigs for five years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month with her business. Maria does her best to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Maria hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 47 years old and married with three children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and earns additional income from abaca weaving.

Lilibeth aspires to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Cyriaque. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un enfant à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Kayi assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Kayi a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Kayi vend depuis une vingtaine d’année des ustensiles de cuisine (bols, bassines, plastiques, etc.) et de façon secondaire des tissus dans une région du Benin. Kayi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Kayi sollicite pour une quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Kayi is 38 years old and married to a man named Cyriaque.  The couple has three children, all of whom are attending school and are dependents. In addition to their children, the couple takes care of another child. The family lives together.

Kayi works as well as her husband to make various household ends meet.  Kayi left school at the secondary level.  To take care of her needs, Kayi has been selling kitchen utensils (bowls, basins, plasticware, etc.) as well as cloths in Benin for twenty years.

Kayi stocks up at a market in Benin.  With the goal of strengthening her business by growing her inventory, she hopes to better meet the needs of her clientele.  To this end, Kayi is asking for her fourth loan from ALIDé.  The previous loans were all properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bowls, plasticware, and basins.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 49-year-old entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a mother of six children and two of them are still her dependents. 

Rufina is engaged in selling home-cooked snacks and electronic cellphone load to her customers. She would like to avail herself of additional capital to buy ingredients like flour, rice, sugar, and cooking oil and to purchase more electronic cellphone load. This will help improve her food production and sales of prepaid load. An increase in her income will provide her children a healthy diet and help her pay their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic cellphone load and ingredients such as flour, rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nounagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUNAGNON est composé de dix sept personnes qui habitent dans le même village et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Jacqueline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Jacqueline est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Charles. Le couple a six enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. Jacqueline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis douze ans, Jacqueline vend des escargots et du maïs dans certaines régions du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Jacqueline vend d’akassa (pâte locale faite à base d'amidon de maïs). Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans plusieurs régions du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Jacqueline et les autres membres du groupement NOUNAGNON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle et par la suite augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Nounagnon group consists of seventeen people who live in the same town and are in revenue-generating businesses in Bénin. The representative of this group, named Jacqueline, is the one whose hand is raised on the photo. Jacqueline is 37 years old and is married to a dressmaker named Charles. The couple has six children, all under their care and some of whom go to school. Jacqueline did not go to school. Jacqueline lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together with her husband.

For twelve years Jacqueline has been selling snails and corn in certain regions of Bénin. On the side, Jacqueline sells akassa [local dough made with corn starch]. Jacqueline gets her supplies in several regions of Bénin. This is the second time that Jacqueline and the other members of the group Nounagnon are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business in order to better meet their clientèle's demands and therefore increase their turnover. The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of 40 snails and a bag of corn.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 26 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Caroline, a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged six months. He has been in the farming business for the past nine years with a monthly income of KES 12,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Charles will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from his business, he will educate his child. His hope is to start green house farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Mercedes cuenta con 24 años de edad es casada, tiene dos niños los cuales  estan estudiando  uno esta cursando primero de primaria se llama Javier y Esteban esta en el preescolar, su esposo se llama Javier es campesino.

Ella es comerciante vende dulces dice que le va muy bien con el negocio ya tiene un año con el negocio y dice que vende muy bien los dulces con los niños de la escuela e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas dulces, paletas, sabritas, pulpas, etc. Ella espera que el negocio vaya incrementando esta echando todas las ganas para salir adelante ya que es una señora que le gusta ganarse las cosas por si misma esta agradecida con su préstamo que fue de gran utilidad.

Mercedes pertenece al grupo las gaviotas el cual esta integrado por 3 hombres y 7 mujeres muy trabajadores a continuación serán mencionados: Juan, Ninfa, Julio, Juana, Estela, Luvia, Bernabé, Mercedes, Nayeli, Gustavo, todos cuenta con una actividad comercial como son: refrescos, productos de abarrotes, fríjol por litro, verduras, dulces, hamburguesas, pescados,  frutas por temporada, tamales, etc.
texts.en: Mercedes is 24 years old, married and has two children: Javier is in first grade and Esteban is in preschool. Her husband, Javier, is a farmer. Mercedes has made a living selling candies for the past year and says that the business is going very well because she sells a lot of candy to schoolchildren. She plans to invest the loan in more candy, ice pops, chips, smoothies, etc. She hopes that the business keeps growing because she uses all of the profits to make headway, since she is a woman who likes to earn things for herself. She is grateful for the loan because it will be a big help. Mercedes belongs to Las Gaviotas group, which consists of three men and seven hard-working women: Juan, Ninfa, Julio, Juana, Estela, Luvia, Bernabé, Mercedes, Nayeli and Gustavo. All of them make a living in commerce, selling beverages, groceries, liters of beans, vegetables, candies, hamburgers, fish, seasonal fruit, tamales, etc.

loans.use: to purchase candies, ice pops, chips, smoothies, etc.

loans.name: Rethecia

texts.en:
Rethecia lives in Yambio. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school.

Rethecia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Wangui

texts.en: Wangui is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She sells beads and necklaces to earn a living. She has been in the business for 13 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. She also does livestock farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy beads and necklaces to sell.

loans.use: To buy beads and necklaces to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old, married, and has three children. With two children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.  She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, sugar, soap, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca es una persona  muy responsable, la cual  junto  con su esposo se  preocupan  por  el  bienestar  de  su   familia   y  por  acondicionar  poco  a poco   la  vivienda  que  con esfuerzo  han   adquirido, ellos  están  muy  contentos  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  los  apoyaremos  en la realización de  su proyecto,  el cual  consiste  en realizar  la compra  de una  puerta  para  su  vivienda, agradece  el  apoyo brindado  para  hacer  de  su sueño una realidad.
texts.en:
Francisca is a very responsible person who, along with her husband, looks after the well-being of her family and renovating little by little the house they have acquired with effort.  They are very happy to have met us because we will help them realize their project, which consists of buying a door for their house.

They are grateful for the support given to make their dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a door.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Conchita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise.  She has been raising livestock for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Conchita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  Divina has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Divina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Mepukori Ole

texts.en:
Mepukori has applied for his fourth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to purchase farm supplies in preparation for the planting season.

The anticipated profits will be used partly to reinvest and also to pay for school fees. His future dream is to better his family's living standards and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: El Jasmin Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jasmin Esta integrado por 8 personas muy alegres y trabajadoras cada una de ella desempeña una actividad economica con el proposito de dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una region cañera  a solo unos minutos del ingenio la margarita uno de los principales productores de caña de la region 

Doña Isaura es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 28 años, es casada con don vicente que es campesino ellos tienen dos hijos uno de 11 años de nombre vicente que estudia la primaria y una pequeña de 4 años Jasmin que asiste al preescolar , y desde hace un poco mas de nueve años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de articulos para el hogar(trastes de cosina) por catalago con sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad y Gracias a Dios con el pasar del tiempo ha hecho buenos clientes los cuales le hacen el gasto
su negocio funciona asi por la mañana hace las tareas del hogar, por la tarde toma sus catalagos y sale a enseñarlo a sus clientes y a levantar pedidos cuando ya tiene suficientes pedidos compra sus articulos y los entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago, a ella le gusta mucho se negocio ya que lo hace en su tiempo libre y no descuida a sus pequeños hijos, Doña Isaura necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra  de variedad de platos, vasos, caserolas y trastes para resurtir su negocio, Ella dice que espera que con este credito sus clientela aumente para que sus ventas y ganancias crescan y asi poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Rebeca venta de pollo
Consuelo venta de comida 
Bernardina venta de abarrotes 
Lucia Venta de antojitos mexicanos 
Minerva venta de refresco
Ingrid venta de pasteles
Miguel venta de pan
texts.en:
The "Jasmin" group is made up of 8 people who are very cheerful and hard-working. Each of them carries out an economic activity with the aim of providing a better quality of life for their families. This group is located in a sugar cane growing region, only a few minutes from La Margarita plant, which is one of the region's main cane producers. 

Isaura is one of the members of this group. She is 28 years old and married to Vicente, who is a rural worker. They have two children: Vicente, age 11, who is in primary school, and a little daughter, Jasmin, age 4, who attends preschool. A little more than nine years ago, Isaura decided to start working in her own business, selling articles for the home (kitchen items) from a catalog. She sells them to her friends and neighbors in the community, and "thanks to God," over time she has found good customers who are willing to buy from her. 

Her business works like this: in the morning she takes care of her household tasks, and in the evening she takes her catalogs and goes out to show them to her customers and take orders. When she has sufficient orders, she buys the items, delivers them to her customers and collects the payments. She enjoys her business very much, since she runs it in her spare time and does not neglect her small children. Isaura needs this loan to invest in buying a variety of plates, glasses, pans and utensils to stock her business. She says that she hopes that with this loan, her customer base will expand, so that her sales and earnings will grow, and thus she can give her family a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are: 

Rebeca, sells chickens
Consuelo, sells food
Bernardina, sells groceries
Lucia, sells Mexican snacks 
Minerva, sells soft drinks
Ingrid, sells pastries
Miguel, sells bread

loans.use: to buy a variety of kitchen items.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y omega esta integrado por 11 personas cada uno de ellas tiene una actividad económica y has solicitado este credito para resurtir sus negocios este grupo es uno de los mas unidos, alegres y amables sus integrantes son: 

Sirina venta de ropa 
Juana venta de ropa 
Avelina venta de antojitos
Maria venta de mole 
Irma venta de tacos 
Veronica venta de ropa 
Fredy venta de pan 
Claudia venta de trastes 
Ariana venta de ropa 
Rosalba venta de ropa 
Lorena-venta de zapatos

Lorena es uno de los integrantes de este grupo tiene 27 años y tiene dos pequeños niños que son su adoración uno de ellos tiene 3 y el otro tiene 5 años de edad. 
Lorena se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, lleva con éste negocio aproximadamente un año y medio, decidió iniciar un negocio para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. “Me encantan los zapatos, así que pensé que vender zapatos sería muy divertido y además tendría un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar, además con éste negocio no descuido a mis pequeños”. 
Con el préstamo que ella está solicitando va a surtirse de zapatos, y comprar los nuevos catálogos. Su meta es ayudar a su esposo para terminar de construir su casa y después de terminada su casa le gustaría tener su propia tienda de zapatos. 
Lorena dice a KIVA y a FRAC: “Gracias por ayudarnos y seguirnos apoyando, ya que sin ustedes no tendríamos para invertir en nuestros negocios”.
texts.en: The Alpha And Omega group consists of 11 women, each of whom earns a living and has requested a loan to help her respective business. This group consists of very united, happy and friendly people: Sirina sells clothing; Juana sells clothing; Avelina sells traditional Mexican snacks; Maria sells chili sauce; Ima sells tacos; Veronica sells clothing; Fredy sells bread; Claudia sells dishes; Ariana sells clothing; Rosalba sells clothing; and Lorena sells shoes. Lorena is 27 years old and has two small children whom she adores. One of them is 3 and the other is 5. Lorena makes a living selling shoes via catalog. She has been in this business for about a year and a half. She decided to start the business to be able to give her children a better quality of life. "I love shoes, so I thought that selling shoes would be a lot of fun and I would also earn extra income to cover household expenses. Furthermore, with this business I don't neglect my young ones," she said. With the loan, she plans to stock up on shoes and purchase the new catalogs. Her goal is to help her husband finish construction on their home, and after finishing the house she would like to have her own shoe store. Lorena says to Kiva and partner FRAC: "Thank you for helping us and continuing to support us, since without you we would not be able to invest in our businesses."

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Cuaresma Group

texts.es:
El grupo se  llama "La Cuaresma"  y se integra de  cuatro señoras  quienes  vivee en una  pequeña comunidad llamada  Morelia.

    La señora Bernardina es casada con el señor Florencio con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes tres a un están a su responsabilidad y uno ya está casado.
 
     Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropas como son: pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropas para bebe en donde lleva trabajando  tres años  y tres meses en la que le va bien.
 
     Inicio  con su actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y darle  lo más necesario a su familia.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad ella pueda seguir adelante hasta  que sus hijos crezcan.

     Quienes integran en l grupo son: Maria de Lourdes invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  tamales y dulces, la señora Mari Cleydi  invertirá en la compra y venta de ropas y la señora Eloisa  invertirá en la compra y venta de pollo de granja.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Cuaresma." It is made up of four women who live in a small community called Morelia.

Bernardina is married to Florencio, with whom she bore four children. Of them, three are still under her responsibility, and one is already married. 
 
She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothing to sell, such as pants, shirts, blouses and baby clothes. She has been working for three years and three months in this business, which is going very well for her. 

She started her business to help her husband with the household income and cover her family's basic necessities. 

What she desires most is that with this activity, she can get ahead until her children grow up. 

The members of the group are: Maria de Lourdes, who will invest in buying ingredients to prepare tamales and sweets; Mari Cleydi, who will invest in buying clothing to sell; and Eloisa, who will invest in buying ranch chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  "Monte Verde" y es  de un lugar llamado  Benito Juárez,  en donde celebran la fiesta de san Pedro en el mes de marzo.

   La señora Maria Celinda es casada con el señor  Norberto con quien procreo cinco  hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

 
  Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de mercancía para surtir su negoció  de abarrotes en donde lleva trabajando  tres años y tres meses y le va muy bien.


   Inicio con esta actividad ya que con ello   podrá ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y darle lo más necesario a su  familia.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda seguir trabajando mientras dios le  preste vida.
 
     Quienes integran en el grupo son: Flor de Luz  quien invertirá en la compra y venta de ropas,  Victoria invertirá en la compra y venta de pollo  de rancho para luego venderlo destazado, la señora Adela invertirá en la compra y venta de pollo de granja y Guadalupe que se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica
texts.en: The "Monte Verde" group is from a place called Benito Juárez, where they celebrate the Festival of Saint Peter in the month of March. Maria Celinda is married to Norberto, with whom she has five children that are still under her care. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her grocery business. She has three years and three months of experience, and it is going very well. She started the store so she would be able to help her husband with household income and provide the most necessities to her family. What she hopes for is that with this small business she can keep working while God preserves her life. The other members of the group are: Flor de Luz, who plans to use the loan to buy and sell clothes; Victoria, who buys and sells chickens; Adela, who buys and sells chickens; and Guadalupe, who makes typical clothing.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies.

loans.name: Hanny Group

texts.es: El señor Baldomero es nuevo integrante del grupo, el va a comprar con su prestamo refacciones para arreglar el taxi, los otros integrantes del grupo siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Virginia tiene 46 años de edad, ella es soltera, ella tiene 4 hijos 2 mujeres y 2 varones,  un hijo esta estudiando el CBTIS los otros ya se casaron, ella tiene una taquería vende taquitos de suadero, carne enchilada y longaniza, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar chiles, tomates, jitomates, carne y verduras, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años por necesidad sus hijos estaban estudiando y para sacarlos adelante, su negocio es importante porque de ahí comen y saca adelante a sus hijos, ella se siente orgullosa cuando le dicen que sus taquitos están sabrosos, ella atiende amablemente a la clientela para que regrese a consumir los taquitos. Ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a surtirse de los insumos para seguir trabajando. Sus sueños y  esperanzas son crecer su negocio, hacer que su negocio sea productivo y que sus hijos estén bien.  Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad "estamos agradecidos con sus prestamos, nos dan la oportunidad de crecer los negocio y que se vean mas bonitos".
texts.en:
Baldomero is a new member to the group, with the money from the loan he is going to buy spare parts to fix his taxi. The other group members are continuing with the activity that they were previously involved with.

Virginia is 46 years old, she is single with four children, 2 girls and 2 boys. One of her sons is studying in a 'CBTis' [Technical High School] and the others are already married. She has a taco stall where she sells beef 'taquitos' (taquitos are corn tortillas that are rolled into a tight cylindrical shape, with meat on the inside), beef enchiladas and sausages. She requested the loan to buy chili peppers, green tomatoes, red tomatoes, beef and vegetables. She started her business 20 years ago out of necessity to pay for her children to go to school and help them get ahead. Her business is important because it allows her to put food on the table and help her children to move forward. She feels proud when people say her 'taquitos' are delicious. She has a friendly demeanor towards her customers so that they will want to come back again. She is happy with this loan because she will be able to stock up on the ingredients she needs to continue working. Her hopes and dreams are to grow the business, to make her business is productive and that her children are well. 

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to 'Fundación Realidad' "We are thankful for your loans, they give us the opportunity to grow our businesses and to make them look more beautiful."

loans.use: to buy green tomatoes, red tomatoes, chili peppers, beef and vegetables.
